summary: Executive profile of a Restaurant professional with leadership as Executive Chef / Sous Chef / Chef Manager. Proven track record in healthy cuisine, menu development, staff training, multi-unit management, cost control, and customer service. Experienced in HACCP, food safety, and culinary education with a focus on high-quality dining experiences and operational efficiency.

experience.title: Store Chef
experience.description: Duties including menu development, one-on-one consultation with customers, design of menus, staff scheduling, and budgeting for a bistro; on and off campus catering; successful menu development and execution resulting in a 20% business increase over 6 months; implemented staff training programs, inventory management with HACCP, and food cost controls and quality standards.

experience.title: Executive Chef
experience.description: Delivers strong operational performance by executing Sodexo and regulatory standards; monitors operations, rounds to maintain client relationships; ensures food safety, sanitation, and workplace safety; supervises and trains staff; manages purchasing, receiving, scheduling, and inventory control; assists in menu planning, pre-costing and post-costing.

experience.title: Executive Chef / Food Service Manager
experience.description: Premium menu design and recipe development; culinary education for kitchen staff; live cooking demonstrations and upscale private catering; nutritional consultancy for health improvement; development and enforcement of nutritional standards across outlets; positive guest feedback and revenue growth; implemented purchasing protocols to secure competitive pricing; reduced waste and maintained food cost below budget by 1â€“2.5 percentage points; recognized for kitchen standards and labor cost reductions.

experience.title: Executive Sous Chef
experience.description: Assisted in directing a $1.5 million renovation of dining facilities and kitchens; lean management through cross-training and reallocating manpower; budget development and forecasting; staffing and coordination across multiple food and beverage areas; managed purchasing, receiving, scheduling, and production.

education.school: Sullivan College and the National Center for Hospitality
Sullivan College and the National Center for Hospitality

certifications: Educational Foundation - National Restaurant Association Certification
